meanings.definition: To record (a television program) by means of a kinescope.
meanings.sent1: She kinescoped her favorite show to watch later.
meanings.sent2: They always kinescoped the news for their grandparents.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally kinescoped over the remote, recording random shows.
meanings.sent4: His memory kinescoped the moment in vivid detail.
meanings.sent5: The camera kinescoped the beautiful sunset perfectly.

meanings.definition: A recording made by means of a kinescope.
meanings.sent1: The kinescoped episode was a hit among viewers.
meanings.sent2: We watched the kinescoped version of the concert.
meanings.sent3: The kinescoped collection of old shows brought back memories.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a kinescoped reel of past events.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed a kinescoped documentary on early television.
